diagnosis.final_diagnosis: hypokalemic-alkalotic salt-losing nephropathy due to CLDN10 mutations
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the identification of compound heterozygous CLDN10 sequence variants in two patients, resulting in a unique phenotype indistinguishable from established syndromes. Key findings included hypokalemic alkalosis, hypocalciuria, and normal to elevated serum magnesium levels, which did not align with Bartter or Gitelman syndromes.
